alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 9:07PM PST until February 23 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM TUESDAY TO 6 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations will be generally up to 6 inches below 6,000 feet. Areas above 6,000 feet will receive 8 to 12 inches with localized amounts near one and a half feet. * WHERE...San Diego County Mountains, including along Interstate 8. * WHEN...4 PM Tuesday to 6 PM Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions, especially during the Tuesday evening commute. Damage to trees and power lines is possible. Visibility greatly reduced in blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS..Heaviest snow on Tuesday night and Wednesday morning. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions are expected. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For road condition information in California...enter 8 0 0 4 2 7 7 6 2 3 if inside california or 9 1 6 4 5 5 7 6 2 3 if outside California.
